title: Nordstrom is preparing to reopen its stores. Here's what the retailer is changing
description: Nordstrom is preparing to reopen some of its department stores, following the lead of Macy's, offering a glimpse at how shopping will be different coming out of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: US services sector posts biggest contraction since 2009 as coronavirus halts economic activity
description: The U.S. services sector contracted for the first time in about a decade last month as the coronavirus pandemic brought economic activity in the country to a near-screeching halt.

title: Dr. Scott Gottlieb warns coronavirus cases will keep rising in May as restrictions are lifted
description: "There's really nothing that's going to keep them from ... going down over the course of this month. The hope is that they don't go up a lot," Dr. Scott Gottlieb told CNBC on Tuesday.

title: NYC officials alarmed with rise in rare disease affecting some kids with coronavirus, Mayor de Blasio says
Pfizer begins human testing for experimental coronavirus vaccine in the US
description: The U.S.-based company, which is working alongside German drugmaker BioNTech, said the first human participants in the United States have been dosed with the potential vaccine, BNT162.

title: Ahead of Disney earnings, chart suggests one key level offers value
description: Disney is about to report earnings. Bill Baruch of Blue Line Capital and Gina Sanchez of Chantico Global discuss what to watch and where it heads from here.

title: AMC Networks expects a dramatic 30% drop in ad revenue this quarter due to coronavirus
description: AMC Networks said it estimates advertising revenue will drop about 30% in the second quarter as marketers pull or delay spend as the coronavirus delays show production.

title: Nearly a fifth of Wendy's US restaurants are out of beef, analyst says
description: Stephens Inc. said its estimate is based on an analysis of online menus for every Wendy's location nationwide.

title: Responsibility for coronavirus precautions at airports is a 'game of hot potato'
description: As government authorities and airlines think about coronavirus health screenings, it isn't clear who's in charge of carrying out new policies.

title: This wartime law gives Trump exceptional power over US economy
description: President Trump has invoked a Korean War-era law to fight the coronavirus pandemic. The Defense Production Act gives the president extraordinary powers over the U.S. economy, which supporters of the move say is necessary to contain the disease.

title: Disney's parks were its biggest profit-maker, now they could be its biggest drag on earnings
description: Last year, Disney's Parks, Experiences and Consumer Products segment was its fastest-growing profit driver. Now, it could be the company's biggest drag on earnings, thanks to the Covid-19 outbreak.

title: Fiat Chrysler to restart US production in two weeks after coronavirus shutdowns lead to $1.8 billion quarterly loss
description: Despite the "unexpected and unprecedented times" due to Covid-19, the company, said Tuesday that it and French automaker PSA Group "remain committed" to a previously announced merger of equals.

title: One of Main Street's biggest fears in economic reopening — new regulations
description: As small businesses across the country grapple with economic reopening, one of their biggest fears is that new regulations will be a net negative for post-Covid-19 Main Street.

title: Dr. Scott Gottlieb says rare, 'unusual phenomena' affecting kids may be linked to coronavirus
description: "There was a notion that this wasn't really affecting kids. It does appear that there are kids being affected by it," the former FDA chief told CNBC.

title: Wayfair shares rocket higher as coronavirus-related store closures shift more demand its way
description: Online furniture retailer Wayfair's net loss widened during the first quarter, as its sales surged nearly 20% from a year ago.

title: Support small businesses with gift cards – but know the risks
description: Purchasing gift cards are a way to support struggling small businesses. But if they don't make it out of the pandemic, you will be out of pocket.

title: Start-up gets $1 billion valuation virtually, as coronavirus shifts Silicon Valley hunt for IPO riches
description: When VAST Data became a unicorn, valued at over $1 billion, in April, it relied on virtual meetings with investors, as Silicon Valley VCs and the IPO market navigate Covid-19.

title: Answers to your biggest questions about US stimulus programs for Covid-19 relief
description: The $2.2 trillion CARES Act has provided several programs to help combat the widespread economic fallout of the coronavirus pandemic, but Americans are still confused. Senior Personal Finance Correspondent Sharon Epperson provides the answers.

title: United Airlines to cut 30% of management in October and braces pilots for changes as well
description: United Airlines plans to cut at least 3,400 management and administrative positions in October as the coronavirus pandemic crushes air travel demand, and has told pilots to brace for changes as well, according to two memos seen by Reuters.

title: How health savings accounts have adjusted for the coronavirus pandemic
description: Health savings accounts, or HSAs, will cover Covid-19-related testing and treatment, among other things.
